metadata.source: HUNTER lead generation - web research, Wikipedia, company websites, public records
metadata.scoring_methodology: A+ = 500+ employees/members, proven break room need, $3K+/mo potential. A = 200+ employees, good fit, $2K+/mo. B+ = 100-200 employees, decent potential. B = Viable but smaller or harder access.
metadata.approach_strategy: Per Skool insights: Never say 'vending'. Pitch as 'AI-powered smart market' or 'modern amenities'. Pop-ins with gift baskets. Rev share 3-5%. Minimum $2K/month revenue potential.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 4550 Nexus Way, North Las Vegas, NV 89115

decision_maker.title: Site General Manager / Facilities Manager
decision_maker.approach: Amazon uses corporate-level vendor management. Contact General Manager at site or reach Amazon Facilities via corporate. Pop-in to front security desk, ask for site ops manager. Also check Amazon's supplier portal for vending RFPs.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: 24/7 operations, massive workforce across 3 shifts, workers have limited break time and need quick snack/drink options. Distribution workers are hungry/thirsty. Break rooms are essential.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Amazon has multiple LV-area fulfillment centers (LAS1, LAS2, LAS6, LAS7). Landing one opens door to all. May already have vendor - check for dissatisfied locations.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 3837 Bay Lake Trail, North Las Vegas, NV 89030

decision_maker.title: Operations Manager / Facilities
decision_maker.approach: Same corporate approach as LAS1. Visit security, ask for ops. Amazon often uses Canteen/Aramark for vending - position as superior local service alternative.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Same as LAS1 - massive captive workforce, 24/7, limited food options during shifts. Workers constantly buying snacks/drinks.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Sortation center - slightly different ops than fulfillment but same vending needs.

segment_1_large_employers.address: Various locations across Las Vegas Valley

decision_maker.title: Station Manager
decision_maker.approach: Delivery stations are smaller and more accessible. Walk in, ask for station manager. Less corporate red tape than fulfillment centers.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Multiple locations = multiple machines. Drivers start early, need coffee/snacks/energy drinks. Break rooms are essential pit stops between routes.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: 4 delivery stations in LV area. Each is a separate placement opportunity.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 8000 Bermuda Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89123

decision_maker.title: Hub Manager / Facilities Manager
decision_maker.approach: FedEx Ground hubs have local management with some vendor authority. Pop-in early morning when management is most accessible. Ask for hub operations manager.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Massive sorting hub, hundreds of workers on multiple shifts. Physical labor = high demand for drinks and snacks. Limited nearby food options in industrial area.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: FedEx also has separate Express, Freight, and Office locations throughout LV. Each is a potential placement.

segment_1_large_employers.company: UPS Customer Center & Hub - Las Vegas
segment_1_large_employers.address: 4480 Nexus Way, North Las Vegas, NV 89115

decision_maker.title: Center Manager / Building Facilities
decision_maker.approach: UPS hub operations. Visit during daytime shift. Ask for building manager or center manager. UPS has some corporate vending contracts but local managers can sometimes make decisions for supplemental machines.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Massive hub with hundreds of package handlers. Physical work = high snack/drink consumption. Workers on short breaks need quick options.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: UPS also has satellite facilities across LV valley. Seasonal employment spikes to 2,000+ during holidays.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 7135 S Decatur Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89118

decision_maker.title: VP of Facilities / Office Manager
decision_maker.approach: Switch is a premium tech company - position as modern smart market amenity matching their high-tech brand. Pop-in to reception, ask for facilities contact.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Tech workers expect modern amenities. 24/7 data center ops means workers at all hours. High-income employees willing to pay premium prices. Multiple buildings on campus.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Switch operates the world's largest data center campus in Las Vegas. Rob Roy (CEO) has built a massive operation. Premium positioning with smart market/healthy options.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 400 Stewart Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89101
segment_1_large_employers.shifts: Primarily daytime, some customer service evening shifts

decision_maker.title: Office Manager / Facilities Director
decision_maker.approach: Zappos HQ at the old City Hall building downtown. Known for fun company culture - pitch smart market as employee perk that fits their vibe. Pop-in to lobby, ask for office operations or facilities team.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Large tech workforce in downtown location. Zappos culture values employee happiness and quirky amenities. Smart market with unique/trendy products would fit perfectly.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Zappos is Amazon-owned but operates independently. Downtown LV location means limited food options for quick breaks.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 1201 N Town Center Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89144

decision_maker.title: VP of Facilities / Corporate Services Manager
decision_maker.approach: Corporate HQ in Summerlin. Large office building with break rooms on multiple floors. Pop-in to reception, pitch as employee amenity upgrade.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Major corporate HQ with thousands of employees. Office workers + operations staff. Growing company adding employees regularly. Break rooms need modern smart market upgrade.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Allegiant also has airport operations with ground crew, mechanics, gate agents - all separate break rooms.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 585 Pilot Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89119
segment_1_large_employers.shifts: Primarily daytime, some evening call center

decision_maker.title: Facilities Manager / Office Services Director
decision_maker.approach: Credit One is a major local employer with a large campus near the airport. Pop-in to reception, ask for facilities or office services. Professional pitch - focus on employee satisfaction and retention.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Large financial services campus, hundreds of call center and office workers. Professional environment that would benefit from premium smart market options.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Credit One has naming rights to the Credit One Stadium (tennis). Major local brand presence.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 6355 S Buffalo Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89113

decision_maker.title: Facilities Director / Office Manager
decision_maker.approach: IGT is a global gaming tech company with major LV operations. Office + manufacturing facility. Pop-in to reception, ask for facilities. Gaming industry people understand vending/amenities well.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Major gaming tech manufacturer and developer. Large campus with office workers AND manufacturing/warehouse workers. Both populations need break room amenities.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: IGT also has a separate office on the Strip. Multiple break room opportunities.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 6601 S Bermuda Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89119

decision_maker.title: Facilities Manager
decision_maker.approach: Similar to IGT - gaming tech company with office and manufacturing. Pop-in to reception, pitch as modern amenity. These companies understand the value proposition.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Large gaming technology employer with manufacturing and office operations. Workers across multiple shifts. Industrial area with limited nearby food options.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Recently rebranded from Scientific Games. Growing company in gaming tech sector.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 585 Trade Center Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89119

decision_maker.title: Office Manager / Facilities
decision_maker.approach: Japanese gaming technology company. Professional approach. Pop-in to reception, ask for office manager or facilities.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Gaming technology company with office and manufacturing. Professional workforce in industrial area near airport. Limited nearby food options makes break room amenities valuable.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Part of Konami Holdings (Japan). Las Vegas is their gaming division HQ.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 8360 S Durango Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89113

decision_maker.title: VP of Corporate Services / Facilities Manager
decision_maker.approach: Major utility company HQ. Professional corporate environment. Pop-in to reception, ask for corporate services or facilities.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Corporate HQ with large office workforce. Plus field operations centers with blue-collar workers who consume more snacks/drinks. Utility companies are stable, long-term contracts.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: SWG also has service centers and satellite offices across LV valley - each is a placement opportunity.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 6226 W Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89146

decision_maker.title: Facilities Director / Corporate Services
decision_maker.approach: Berkshire Hathaway subsidiary. Large corporate campus. Pop-in to reception, professional pitch. Emphasize employee amenity enhancement.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Major electric utility with corporate HQ and operations centers. Large stable workforce. Multiple buildings = multiple machine placements. Utility employees have high job tenure = consistent revenue.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: NV Energy has multiple service centers, substations with break rooms, and the main HQ campus. Warren Buffett-owned = financially stable.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 2290 Corporate Circle Dr, Henderson, NV 89074

decision_maker.title: Facilities Manager / VP Operations
decision_maker.approach: Large call center in Henderson's corporate corridor. Call center workers are snack/drink heavy consumers. Pop-in to reception, ask for facilities or operations management.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Massive call center with multi-shift operations. Call center workers are among the highest vending consumers (sedentary work, need energy). Henderson location aligns with our base. Green Valley Corporate Center area.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Located in the same Green Valley Corporate Center area where we already have leads. Can bundle with other corporate tenants.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 770 E Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89104

decision_maker.title: Facilities Manager / Operations Director
decision_maker.approach: Major waste hauler with large LV workforce. Drivers start early AM. Pop-in to operations office, ask for facilities. Blue-collar workforce = high snack/drink consumption.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Large fleet of drivers plus office staff. Early morning start times mean workers need breakfast/snack/energy drink options. Break rooms at dispatch centers are prime locations.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Republic Services is one of the largest waste companies in the US. Multiple depots/service centers across LV valley.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 6260 N Hollywood Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89115
segment_1_large_employers.shifts: Multiple shifts, especially during peak seasons

decision_maker.title: Warehouse Manager / Facilities
decision_maker.approach: Large distribution center in North Las Vegas industrial area. Pop-in to front office, ask for warehouse or facilities manager. Position as employee benefit.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Large DC with warehouse workers on multiple shifts. Physical work = high consumption. Industrial area with zero nearby food options. Break rooms are the only snack source.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: North Las Vegas industrial corridor has multiple large distribution centers that are untapped.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 3150 Paradise Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89109

decision_maker.title: Director of Facilities / Convention Services Manager
decision_maker.approach: LVCVA manages the convention center. Government entity - may require bid process. Contact facilities division. During events, thousands of vendors/exhibitors/attendees use the facility.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Massive facility with permanent staff plus huge event populations. Back-of-house break rooms for staff AND employee corridors during conventions. Revenue spikes during major events.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Recently expanded with $1B+ West Hall addition. Government entity so may need formal procurement process.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 1700 Vegas Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89106

decision_maker.title: Facilities Manager / Regional VP
decision_maker.approach: Major cable/internet provider with large LV workforce. Office workers + field technicians. Pop-in to main office, ask for facilities.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Large telecom workforce with office campus and multiple satellite locations. Field technicians operate from dispatch centers with break rooms. Stable employer with low turnover.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Cox is the dominant cable/internet provider in LV. Multiple service centers across the valley.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 1001 E Sunset Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89199

decision_maker.title: Plant Manager / Facilities Coordinator
decision_maker.approach: USPS facilities often have existing vending contracts but they can be displaced. Federal entity - check for GSA vending schedule. Pop-in to administrative office during business hours.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Massive 24/7 mail processing facility. Thousands of workers across 3 shifts. Physical labor = high snack/drink demand. Limited food options for night shift workers.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: USPS is technically quasi-government. May have existing Randolph-Sheppard Act considerations. Check current vendor status.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 6750 Via Industria, Las Vegas, NV 89115

decision_maker.title: Plant HR Director / Facilities Manager
decision_maker.approach: Tesla Gigafactory partner in North Las Vegas industrial area. Massive manufacturing plant. Pop-in to front office, ask for HR or facilities. Japanese company - professional, respect-based approach.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: One of the largest manufacturing facilities in Nevada. 3,000+ workers across 24/7 shifts. Manufacturing workers are among the highest vending consumers. Remote industrial location = zero nearby food.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Partners with Tesla for battery production. Part of the North Las Vegas industrial boom. Multiple break rooms needed for this size facility.

segment_1_large_employers.address: 2800 Sturgis Rd, Oxnard CA (LV distribution: Henderson area)

decision_maker.title: Distribution Center Manager
decision_maker.approach: CNC machine manufacturer with LV-area distribution. Pop-in to facility, ask for center manager.

segment_1_large_employers.why_good_fit: Industrial distribution center with blue-collar workforce. Workers need break room amenities. Industrial area location.
segment_1_large_employers.notes: Smaller than Amazon/FedEx but still viable. Good entry point into Henderson industrial corridor.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 3799 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109

decision_maker.title: VP of Employee Services / HR Director
decision_maker.approach: MGM Resorts is the parent company (63,000 employees worldwide). Target employee break rooms, not guest areas. Contact HR or Employee Services department. Getting into one MGM property = door to 10+ Strip properties. Corporate decision likely needed - find VP-level HR or Facilities contact.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: One of the largest single-site employers in Las Vegas. 8,000+ employees across 24/7 shifts. Employee dining rooms/break rooms are massive and serve thousands daily. Current break room amenities may be outdated.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: WHALE ACCOUNT. MGM Resorts owns Bellagio, ARIA, Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur, NY-NY, Park MGM, Vdara. Landing employee break rooms across the portfolio = $50K+/month total. Decision likely at corporate level: MGM Resorts HR, 3600 Las Vegas Blvd South.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 3600 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109

decision_maker.title: Director of Employee Relations / Facilities Director
decision_maker.approach: Same MGM Resorts family. Premium property = pitch premium smart market for employee areas. Also houses MGM Resorts corporate offices.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Massive workforce, premium property. Employee back-of-house areas serve thousands. Located at MGM corporate HQ building as well.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Bellagio is MGM Resorts' flagship. Getting in here signals quality to other properties.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 3570 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109

decision_maker.title: VP of Team Member Services / Facilities Director
decision_maker.approach: Caesars Entertainment (50,000 employees worldwide). Target employee ('Team Member') break rooms and dining areas. Contact Team Member Services or HR. Landing Caesars Palace = entry to Flamingo, Harrah's, Paris, LINQ, Horseshoe, Cromwell.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Massive single-property employer. 24/7 operations. Employee areas include break rooms, dining halls, locker areas. Caesars Entertainment owns 8+ Strip properties.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: WHALE ACCOUNT. Caesars Entertainment portfolio in LV: Caesars Palace, Flamingo, Paris, Harrah's, The LINQ, Horseshoe, The Cromwell, Caesars Forum. Total LV employees: 20,000+.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 3131 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109

decision_maker.title: VP of Team Member Services / Director of Employee Relations
decision_maker.approach: Wynn Resorts (28,000 employees total). Ultra-premium brand. Pitch high-end smart market matching their brand quality. Employee break rooms at Wynn are reportedly nicer than most. Find HR/Employee Services director.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Premium property with massive workforce. Wynn employees expect quality amenities. Both Wynn and Encore share back-of-house areas. Ultra-premium positioning = higher average ticket price.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Wynn Resorts has fewer properties but high employee density. Wynn + Encore combined. Premium pricing opportunity.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 3355 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109

decision_maker.title: VP of Human Resources / Facilities Director
decision_maker.approach: Owned by Apollo Global Management (The Venetian Resort). One of the largest properties on the Strip. Contact HR or team member services. Pop-in to employee entrance (usually rear of property).

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Among the largest resorts on the Strip. Combined 7,000+ suite resort with massive convention center. Enormous employee population. Multiple break rooms across the massive property.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: The Venetian/Palazzo also includes The Venetian Expo convention center. Employee + convention service staff combined.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.company: Station Casinos - Green Valley Ranch Resort (Employee Areas)

decision_maker.title: Employee Services Manager / HR Director
decision_maker.approach: Station Casinos (9,385 employees total, HQ: 1505 S Pavilion Center Dr, LV 89135). Green Valley Ranch is their Henderson flagship. Contact Employee Services or HR. Getting into GVR = door to Palace Station, Boulder Station, Sunset Station, Red Rock, Santa Fe, Durango.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Henderson's premier casino resort. Large local workforce. Employee break rooms serve hundreds per shift. Station Casinos owns 7+ properties = massive portfolio opportunity.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: WHALE ACCOUNT. Station Casinos portfolio: Palace Station, Boulder Station, Sunset Station (Henderson), GVR (Henderson), Red Rock, Santa Fe Station, Durango, + Wildfire locations. CEO: Frank Fertitta III. Corporate: (702) 495-4270.

decision_maker.title: HR Manager / Employee Services
decision_maker.approach: Second Station Casinos Henderson property. Same corporate approach as GVR. Bundle pitch for both Henderson properties.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Major Henderson locals casino. Large employee base. Employee break rooms across the property. Henderson location aligns with our base.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Part of Station Casinos portfolio. If we land GVR, Sunset Station should follow. Located off I-215.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.company: Station Casinos - Red Rock Casino Resort (Employee Areas)
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 11011 W Charleston Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89135

decision_maker.title: HR Director / Employee Services Manager
decision_maker.approach: Station Casinos' premium Summerlin property. Red Rock was $925M to build - their most expensive property. Premium employee amenities expected.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Station's flagship premium property. Large workforce in affluent Summerlin area. Employees expect quality amenities.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Near Station Casinos HQ. Premium location commands premium pricing.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.company: Station Casinos - Durango Casino & Resort (Employee Areas)
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 5765 S Durango Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89113

decision_maker.title: HR Manager / Employee Services
decision_maker.approach: Station's newest property (opened Dec 2023). Brand new facility = fresh opportunity with no established vending vendor. First-mover advantage.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Brand new casino (opened Dec 2023). Fresh facility may not have established vending contracts. Modern property = receptive to modern smart market concept. Growing employee base.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: PRIORITY TARGET - New facility often doesn't have entrenched vendor relationships. Strike while the iron is hot.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.company: Boyd Gaming - Orleans Hotel & Casino (Employee Areas)
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 4500 W Tropicana Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89103

decision_maker.title: VP of Human Resources / Facilities Director
decision_maker.approach: Boyd Gaming (15,114 employees, HQ in Spring Valley). The Orleans is one of their largest LV properties. Contact HR department. Getting into Boyd Gaming = access to Orleans, Suncoast, Sam's Town, California, Main Street Station, Cannery, etc.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Large locals casino with major event center. Thousands of employees. Boyd Gaming has extensive LV portfolio. Employee break rooms are high-traffic.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Boyd Gaming portfolio includes 10+ LV properties. Landing one = door to portfolio. Boyd HQ is nearby.

decision_maker.title: HR Manager / Employee Services
decision_maker.approach: Boyd Gaming property on Boulder Highway corridor. Same corporate approach. Bundle with Orleans pitch.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Historic locals casino on Boulder Hwy. Large employee base. Employee break rooms serve hundreds per shift.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Sam's Town is a landmark property. One of the original 'locals' casinos. Stable employee base.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 2000 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89104

decision_maker.title: Director of HR / Facilities Manager
decision_maker.approach: Golden Entertainment (7,200 employees, HQ in Enterprise NV). The STRAT is their flagship. Contact HR or Employee Services. CEO is Blake Sartini - former Station Casinos exec.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Iconic property with large workforce. Employee areas including break rooms, locker rooms. Golden Entertainment also owns Arizona Charlie's properties = portfolio opportunity.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Golden Entertainment also operates PT's taverns across LV. STRAT went through $140M renovation.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 3000 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109

decision_maker.title: VP of People & Culture / Facilities Director
decision_maker.approach: Newest major resort on the Strip (opened 2021). Genting Group owned. Modern property may be receptive to modern amenity concepts. Contact People & Culture (their HR term) department.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Relatively new mega-resort (opened June 2021). $4.3 billion property. Large workforce in modern facility. May not have entrenched vending vendor. Modern property aligns with smart market concept.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: PRIORITY TARGET - New property. 3,500 rooms. Massive operation. First major Strip resort built in a decade.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 3708 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109

decision_maker.title: Director of HR / VP of Team Member Services
decision_maker.approach: Now owned by MGM Resorts (acquired 2022 for $1.6B). Can be approached through MGM corporate channels or independently. Trendy property = receptive to modern concepts.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Premium boutique resort with large workforce. Known for trendy/modern aesthetic - perfect match for smart market concept. Now part of MGM portfolio.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Part of MGM Resorts portfolio since 2022. Can be bundled with MGM corporate pitch.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 9777 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89183

decision_maker.title: HR Director / Facilities Manager
decision_maker.approach: Independently owned by Michael Gaughan. Not a chain - decision maker is more accessible. Pop-in to HR department. Independent ownership = faster decision process.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Large independently owned casino resort. 2,163 rooms, massive event center, equestrian center. Independent ownership means fewer corporate hoops. Large, stable workforce.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Michael Gaughan (gaming legend) is the owner. Independent = faster decisions. South Point also hosts major events (bowling, equestrian) with temporary workforce surges.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.address: 12300 Las Vegas Blvd S, Henderson, NV 89044

decision_maker.title: HR Manager / Director of Employee Services
decision_maker.approach: Owned by Penn Entertainment. Henderson-adjacent location. Modern property opened 2009. Contact HR department.

segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.why_good_fit: Modern resort near Henderson. Employee break rooms. Henderson location aligns with our base. Penn Entertainment is the parent - possible portfolio play.
segment_2_hotels_casinos_employee_areas.notes: Penn Entertainment (NYSE: PENN) owns. Located at the southern tip of the Strip. Henderson-adjacent.

segment_3_government_buildings.company: City of Henderson - City Hall Complex

decision_maker.title: City Manager: Stephanie Garcia Vause / Facilities Division
decision_maker.name: Stephanie Garcia Vause (City Manager/CEO)
decision_maker.approach: Government procurement process. Check cityofhenderson.com for RFPs/vendor opportunities. Contact Purchasing Division. Mayor: Michelle Romero. City Council can approve vendor contracts. Start with Facilities Division within Public Works department.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: Large government complex with hundreds of employees. Stable, long-term contract. Government employees are consistent snack/drink consumers. Multiple buildings = multiple placements.
segment_3_government_buildings.contract_process: Municipal RFP/bid process. Check cityofhenderson.com purchasing portal. May have sole-source threshold for smaller contracts.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: Henderson is our home base. City Hall is just the start - Henderson has multiple city facilities: recreation centers, fire stations, police HQ, utility offices, convention center.

segment_3_government_buildings.company: City of Henderson - Water Street District Municipal Buildings

decision_maker.title: Director of Administrative Services / Facilities
decision_maker.approach: Multiple city department buildings along Water Street and surrounding blocks. Bundle with City Hall pitch. Same procurement process.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: Multiple government buildings in close proximity. Walking distance from each other = efficient servicing route. Government employees in each building.
segment_3_government_buildings.contract_process: Same City of Henderson procurement as GOV-001.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: Includes: Justice Court, Detention Center admin, Parks & Rec offices, Community Development.

segment_3_government_buildings.address: 500 S Grand Central Pkwy, Las Vegas, NV 89106

decision_maker.title: County Manager: Kevin Schiller / Facilities Management Division
decision_maker.name: Kevin Schiller (County Manager)
decision_maker.approach: Clark County is massive (2.4M population, 12,000+ employees). Government Center is the main hub. Contact Facilities Management Division or Purchasing. Check clarkcountynv.gov for vendor registration and current solicitations.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: Massive government complex housing multiple county departments. Thousands of employees daily. High public foot traffic. Multiple buildings in the complex. Commissioners: Michael Naft (Chair).
segment_3_government_buildings.contract_process: Clark County procurement process. Register as vendor at clarkcountynv.gov. Check for active solicitations.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: Clark County has 12,000+ total employees across all facilities. Government Center is the crown jewel but there are dozens of satellite offices, libraries, parks, etc.

decision_maker.title: Court Administrator / Facilities Manager
decision_maker.approach: Major courthouse complex. Staff + attorneys + jurors + public = high foot traffic. Contact court administration or Clark County Facilities. Same county procurement process.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: High-traffic courthouse. Hundreds of staff plus daily visitors (attorneys, jurors, plaintiffs, defendants). People wait for hours = captive audience. Employee break rooms + public waiting areas.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: Jurors especially need snack/drink options during long waits. Attorney break rooms and staff areas are separate placement opportunities.

segment_3_government_buildings.address: 333 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89101

decision_maker.title: GSA Building Manager / Court Clerk
decision_maker.approach: Federal building managed by GSA (General Services Administration). Federal vending contracts go through Randolph-Sheppard Act (priority for blind vendors). Check GSA vendor portal. May need to partner with state blind vendor program.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: Federal courthouse with staff and daily visitors. Stable government contract. Premium location downtown Las Vegas.
segment_3_government_buildings.contract_process: GSA procurement. Randolph-Sheppard Act considerations. Check sam.gov for solicitations.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: Federal buildings have specific vending regulations. The Randolph-Sheppard Act gives priority to blind vendors. May need to check Nevada's BEP (Business Enterprise Program) for compliance.

segment_3_government_buildings.address: 110 N City Pkwy, Las Vegas, NV 89106
segment_3_government_buildings.shifts: Business hours, extended during tax season

decision_maker.title: Building Manager / GSA Facilities
decision_maker.approach: Federal facility. Same GSA/Randolph-Sheppard considerations. Employee count surges Jan-April (tax season). Contact building management through GSA.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: Large federal office with hundreds of employees. Seasonal workforce surges during tax season. Employee break rooms serve staff who can't easily leave the building.
segment_3_government_buildings.contract_process: GSA procurement. Federal vendor registration required.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: IRS employees often have limited lunch break flexibility. Captive audience = consistent revenue. Revenue spikes during tax season.

segment_3_government_buildings.address: 1250 S Buffalo Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89117

decision_maker.title: Office Manager / GSA Building Manager
decision_maker.approach: Federal office with high public traffic. People wait for hours at SSA offices. Contact building management or GSA.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: High foot traffic from public visitors who wait for long periods. Employees work in the office full-time. Waiting room = captive audience for snacks/drinks.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: Multiple SSA offices in LV area. This is the largest. Long wait times = hungry/thirsty visitors.

decision_maker.title: 99th Air Base Wing / AAFES (Army & Air Force Exchange Service)
decision_maker.name: Colonel Joshua DeMotts (Base Commander)
decision_maker.approach: Military base vending is managed by AAFES (Army & Air Force Exchange Service) or base MWR (Morale, Welfare & Recreation). Contact AAFES regional office or base MWR. Military vending contracts go through federal procurement but AAFES manages the process. Base access required - start with base contracting office.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: Massive military installation with 10,000+ personnel. Multiple buildings, offices, hangars, dormitories. AAFES vending contracts can be lucrative and long-term. 24/7 operations means constant demand.
segment_3_government_buildings.contract_process: AAFES (Army & Air Force Exchange Service) manages base vending. Check exchange.aafes.com for vendor opportunities. May need background clearance for base access.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: WHALE ACCOUNT. Nellis AFB hosts the USAF Thunderbirds, multiple wings, and thousands of personnel. 11,300 acres. Getting Nellis = potential for Creech AFB too. AAFES regional office handles vendor selections.

segment_3_government_buildings.address: Indian Springs, NV 89018 (45 min from Las Vegas)

decision_maker.title: 432d Wing / AAFES / MWR
decision_maker.name: Colonel Stephen R. Jones (Base Commander)
decision_maker.approach: Same AAFES process as Nellis. Creech is remote (Indian Springs, 45 min from LV) = limited food options = higher vending demand. Contact through AAFES or base contracting.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: Remote military base with 24/7 drone operations. Extremely limited food options in Indian Springs area. Personnel need on-base snack/drink options. High demand due to isolation.
segment_3_government_buildings.contract_process: AAFES procurement. Same process as Nellis.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: Home of US drone operations (MQ-9 Reaper). 2,300 acres. Remote location = very high per-capita vending consumption. Service would require longer drive for restocking.

decision_maker.title: Chief of Police / Administrative Services Division
decision_maker.approach: Police departments are great vending locations (per Skool insights - 'police station placements' was a hot topic). Officers on shift need quick food/drink. Contact administrative services division. City of Henderson procurement.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: 24/7 law enforcement facility. Officers on shift need break room snacks/drinks. Civilian staff during daytime. Police stations mentioned as good locations in Skool community.
segment_3_government_buildings.contract_process: City of Henderson procurement. May be bundled with other city facility contracts.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: Skool community specifically mentioned police stations as good placements. Henderson PD also has substations throughout the city.

segment_3_government_buildings.company: Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department (LVMPD) HQ
segment_3_government_buildings.address: 400 S Martin Luther King Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89106

decision_maker.title: LVMPD Fiscal Affairs Bureau / Facilities Section
decision_maker.approach: One of the largest police departments in the US. HQ plus multiple area commands across the valley. Contact Fiscal Affairs or Facilities section. Clark County procurement process likely applies.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: Massive police force. HQ + 6 area command stations across LV valley. Each location has break rooms. 5,000+ total employees across all facilities. 24/7 operations = constant demand.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: WHALE ACCOUNT. LVMPD has HQ + 6 area commands + training facility + forensic lab + other facilities. Each is a placement opportunity. Landing HQ = door to all locations.

segment_3_government_buildings.company: Clark County School District (CCSD) Administrative Complex
segment_3_government_buildings.address: 5100 W Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89146

decision_maker.title: Superintendent / Facilities Division Director
decision_maker.approach: CCSD is the 5th largest school district in the US. Administrative complex alone has 1,000+ employees. Schools are Tier 1 locations per Skool insights ('never seen an unprofitable school'). Contact Facilities Division or Purchasing department.

segment_3_government_buildings.why_good_fit: 5th largest school district in the US. Admin complex + 360+ schools. Schools are top-tier vending locations per industry data. Students are impulsive buyers. MASSIVE portfolio opportunity.
segment_3_government_buildings.contract_process: CCSD formal procurement. Must register as vendor. RFP process for district-wide contracts.
segment_3_government_buildings.notes: ULTIMATE WHALE. CCSD has 360+ schools and 40,000+ employees. Landing the admin complex is step 1. Then pursue schools individually or district-wide contract. Skool says schools are 'never unprofitable'.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: Various locations across Las Vegas Valley
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.employee_count: 2,500+ (Nevada operations across 35 total dealerships, 15+ in LV)
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.shifts: Business hours + service dept extended hours

decision_maker.title: VP of Operations / Regional Director / Facilities Manager
decision_maker.approach: WHALE ACCOUNT. Findlay has 35 dealerships across 5 states, started in LV 1961. Pete Findlay Oldsmobile was the first. Target corporate management for multi-location deal. Each dealership has employee break room + customer waiting area = 2 machines per location minimum. Pop-in to a dealership first, then pitch corporate for all locations.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: 15+ dealerships in Las Vegas area. Each has 100-200 employees + customer traffic. Customer waiting areas (service dept) are captive audiences waiting 1-4 hours. Employee break rooms for sales/service staff. Corporate deal = 30+ machine placements.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: ULTIMATE WHALE. 35 locations, 5 states. LV locations include Chevrolet, Toyota, Honda, Hyundai, Kia, Subaru, Buick/GMC, Lincoln, CJDR, Cadillac. Each location: 1 employee break room machine + 1 customer waiting area machine = 30+ machines minimum. Service customers wait 1-4 hours = perfect captive audience.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: 6800 S Torrey Pines Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89118

decision_maker.title: General Manager / Service Director
decision_maker.approach: Individual Findlay dealership. Pop-in, ask for General Manager. Bring gift basket. Pitch both employee break room and customer waiting area. Service department waiting area is the money spot.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: One of Findlay's largest LV dealerships. Large service department with customer waiting area. Employees need break room amenities. High service volume = lots of waiting customers.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Gateway to the full Findlay corporate relationship. Start here, prove the concept, then pitch corporate for all locations.

decision_maker.title: General Manager / Service Director
decision_maker.approach: Henderson location - our home turf. Toyota service departments are typically very busy. Pop-in with gift basket, pitch to GM.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Henderson location. Toyota service departments are among the busiest. Customers wait 1-3 hours for service. Employee break rooms serve 150+ staff.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Henderson location = easy to service. Toyota dealers have high service volume.

decision_maker.title: General Manager
decision_maker.approach: Valley Automall location in Henderson. Pop-in, ask for GM. Multiple dealerships in the Automall = can visit several in one trip.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Valley Automall location = cluster of dealerships. Honda service departments are busy. Customer waiting area + employee break room.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Located in the Valley Automall cluster. Hit multiple dealerships in one pop-in sweep.

decision_maker.title: Individual dealership General Managers
decision_maker.approach: The Valley Automall is a cluster of 20+ dealerships on Auto Show Dr in Henderson. Plan a full-day pop-in sweep: visit each dealership with gift baskets. Target service departments first (customer waiting areas). Each GM makes their own decision. Document the cluster deal potential for a portfolio pitch.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: 20+ dealerships in one compact area. Thousands of employees combined. Each service department has captive waiting customers. Geographic density = efficient servicing route.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: MEGA WHALE. Dealerships in the Automall include: Honda, Chevrolet, Dodge, Chrysler, Jeep, Ram, Subaru, Hyundai, Kia, Nissan, BMW, VW, and more. Each dealership: 2 machines (1 employee, 1 customer). 20+ dealerships = 40+ machines.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: 6300 West Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89146

decision_maker.title: General Manager / Service Director
decision_maker.approach: AutoNation is a major national chain. Landing one = pitch to AutoNation corporate for all LV locations. Pop-in to service department area.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: AutoNation is the largest auto retailer in the US. Large service department. Customer waiting area is captive audience. Corporate relationship = multiple locations.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: AutoNation has multiple LV dealerships across brands. Corporate deal potential.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: Multiple locations across Las Vegas Valley

decision_maker.title: Center Manager / Regional Manager
decision_maker.approach: Caliber Collision is the largest collision repair chain in the US. Multiple LV locations. Employee break rooms at each location. Customers also wait for estimates. Pop-in to individual centers, ask for center manager.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Multiple locations in LV/Henderson. Each has employee break room + customer waiting area. Collision work means longer wait times for estimates. Blue-collar workers = high snack/drink consumption.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Caliber has 5+ LV-area locations. Also consider Service King (another large chain) and Gerber Collision.

decision_maker.title: VP of Operations / Corporate Facilities
decision_maker.approach: Chapman is another major LV dealership group with multiple brands: Dodge/Chrysler/Jeep/Ram, BMW, Cadillac, Chrysler. Corporate approach for multi-location deal. Pop-in to individual stores first.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Major LV dealership group with 5+ locations. Each has employee break room + customer waiting area. Similar pitch to Findlay but different owner.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Chapman group includes Chapman Chrysler Jeep, Chapman BMW, Chapman Cadillac, and others. Portfolio deal potential.

decision_maker.title: General Manager
decision_maker.approach: Henderson location. Ford service departments handle high volume. Pop-in, gift basket, pitch to GM.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Henderson location. Ford is the #1 selling truck brand - high service volume. Customer waiting area + employee break room.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Ford F-150 is #1 selling vehicle in Nevada. High service department traffic.

decision_maker.title: General Manager
decision_maker.approach: Pop-in, gift basket, pitch to GM. Lincoln side = premium clientele waiting for service.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Ford/Lincoln dealership. Premium Lincoln customers expect amenities while waiting. Large service department.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Lincoln premium brand = higher average purchase price from smart market.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: 7300 West Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89117

decision_maker.title: General Manager / Service Director
decision_maker.approach: One of the largest Mercedes dealers in the US. Premium clientele expects premium amenities. Pitch upscale smart market for service waiting area. Pop-in professional dress.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: One of the highest-volume Mercedes dealers nationally. Premium customers waiting for service expect quality amenities. Large employee base. Service customers often wait 2-4 hours.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Fletcher Jones is a mega-dealer. Premium brand = premium pricing. Service waiting area could support micro market concept.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: 8575 W Centennial Pkwy, Las Vegas, NV 89149

decision_maker.title: General Manager / Operations Director
decision_maker.approach: Multi-brand dealership group in NW Las Vegas. Multiple locations = portfolio deal potential. Pop-in to main location first.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Multi-location dealership group. Each location has employee break room + customer waiting area. North/Northwest LV coverage.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Jim Marsh has Kia, Chrysler, Dodge, Jeep, Ram, and other brands. Multiple NW LV locations.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.company: Jiffy Lube (Heartland Automotive - Las Vegas area)
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: Multiple locations across Las Vegas Valley

decision_maker.title: Regional Manager / Franchise Owner
decision_maker.approach: Jiffy Lube locations have customer waiting areas where people wait 30-60 min for oil changes. Smaller employee base but high customer traffic. Contact regional franchise operator.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Customer waiting areas with 30-60 min captive audiences. 15+ locations in LV area. Small footprint = space for 1 machine per location. Quick oil change customers are impulse buyers.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Individual locations are smaller but volume across 15+ locations adds up. Single franchise operator may control multiple locations.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: Multiple locations across Las Vegas Valley

decision_maker.title: Store Manager / Regional Manager
decision_maker.approach: Discount Tire has massive customer waiting areas (customers wait 1-2 hours for tire services). Employee break rooms at each. Pop-in to individual stores, ask for manager.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Customer waiting areas with 1-2 hour waits. High foot traffic. 10+ locations in LV area. Waiting customers are very receptive to snack/drink purchases.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Discount Tire is the largest independent tire retailer in the US. Corporate HQ in Scottsdale, AZ - relatively close for relationship building.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: Multiple locations across Las Vegas Valley

decision_maker.title: Franchise Owner / Store Manager
decision_maker.approach: Franchise model - each location has an owner/operator. Pop-in, pitch to owner. Customer waiting area is the money spot.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Customer waiting areas. Service waits of 1-3 hours. Franchise owners can make quick decisions without corporate red tape.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Franchise model means quicker decisions but need to pitch each owner individually.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.address: Multiple locations across Las Vegas Valley

decision_maker.title: Store Manager / Regional Manager
decision_maker.approach: Pep Boys has retail + service. Customer waiting areas for service. Pop-in to stores, ask for manager.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Retail + service combination. Customers wait for service. Employee break rooms. Multiple LV locations.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Pep Boys is now owned by Icahn Enterprises. 5+ LV locations.

decision_maker.title: General Manager / Operations Director
decision_maker.approach: Towbin has Dodge/Chrysler/Jeep/Ram, Infiniti, and other brands in LV. Portfolio deal potential. Pop-in to largest location first.

segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.why_good_fit: Multi-location dealership group. Employee break rooms + customer waiting areas at each location. LV-based group with quick decision potential.
segment_4_auto_dealerships_service.notes: Towbin dealership group - prominent LV auto group. Multiple brands.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.address: 2501 N Green Valley Pkwy, Henderson, NV 89014

decision_maker.title: Club Manager / Regional Manager
decision_maker.approach: ES Fitness has 4+ Henderson/LV locations. Target regional manager for multi-location deal. Pop-in to this location, ask for club manager. Pitch smart market for member lobby area.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: 24/7 gym with thousands of members. Post-workout = hungry/thirsty. High traffic throughout the day. Members expect modern amenities. Healthy snack/drink options align perfectly.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: ES has been rapidly expanding in LV/Henderson area. 4+ locations in Henderson alone. Regional manager deal = 8+ machine placements.

decision_maker.title: Club Manager
decision_maker.approach: Second Henderson ES location. Bundle with Green Valley pitch.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Same as FR-001. Henderson location, 24/7 operation, high member traffic.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Bundle deal with all Henderson ES locations.

decision_maker.title: Club Manager
decision_maker.approach: Third Henderson ES. Part of multi-location pitch.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Henderson location. High-growth area near Anthem. Large member base.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Anthem/Seven Hills area - affluent member base willing to pay premium.

decision_maker.title: Club Manager
decision_maker.approach: Fourth Henderson ES. Complete the full Henderson ES sweep.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Henderson St. Rose Pkwy area. Growing Inspirada/Cadence neighborhood nearby. High member traffic.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: New growth area in Henderson. Lots of new residents joining gyms.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.company: LVAC - Las Vegas Athletic Clubs (7 Locations)
segment_5_fitness_recreation.address: Various locations across Las Vegas Valley

decision_maker.title: Owner/CEO / Regional Operations Manager
decision_maker.approach: LVAC is locally owned with 7 locations. 24/7 operation. Contact corporate office for multi-location deal. Locally owned = faster decision than national chains. Pop-in to any location, ask for club manager to get introduced to corporate.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: 7 locations all open 24 hours. Locally owned = relationship-based decision. 30,000+ members across all locations. Post-workout snack/drink demand is huge. Modern facilities expect modern amenities.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: WHALE ACCOUNT. Local owner = can build relationship. 7 locations  healthy vending = $10K+/month. Position with protein shakes, healthy snacks, energy drinks. 24/7 = revenue at all hours.

decision_maker.title: General Manager / Regional VP
decision_maker.approach: Life Time is an upscale 'athletic country club'. Premium members = premium purchasing power. Contact General Manager. Life Time corporate (Chanhassen, MN) may need to approve, but GM has significant local authority.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Premium fitness club with affluent membership. Members spend $100-200+/month on membership = willing to buy premium snacks/drinks. Large facility with cafe area, pool area, basketball courts. Multiple placement zones.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Life Time members are high-income. Premium healthy products command premium prices. Pool area, basketball courts, kids area = multiple machine locations. One of the only gyms with this upscale demographic.

decision_maker.title: Franchise Owner / Club Manager
decision_maker.approach: Planet Fitness is franchise model. Each location has owner-operator who makes decisions. Pop-in, ask for owner or club manager. Budget gym members still buy snacks/drinks.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: High-volume budget gym. Large membership numbers per location. Members are not 'gym rats' (Planet Fitness' whole brand) = more likely to buy snacks/drinks vs. strict macro-counters.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Skool warns against 'weightlifting gyms' (macro counters) but Planet Fitness is the opposite - casual fitness. Members buy snacks. Franchise owners decide quickly.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.address: 250 S Green Valley Pkwy, Henderson, NV 89012

decision_maker.title: Parks & Recreation Director / Facility Manager
decision_maker.approach: City of Henderson facility. Same procurement as GOV-001. Recreation centers are Tier 1 per Skool insights ('Print Money' locations). Parents/kids stay for hours. Contact Parks & Rec department.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: TIER 1 LOCATION per Skool insights. Recreation centers are 'Print Money' locations. Tournaments, captive parents/kids, 2-4 hour stays. Impulsive buying from kids and parents. Year-round programming.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Skool specifically says recreation centers are Tier 1 - 'tournaments, captive parents/kids, 2-4 hour stays'. Henderson Parks & Rec also has other facilities.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.address: 200 S Green Valley Pkwy, Henderson, NV 89012

decision_maker.title: Facility Manager / City of Henderson Events
decision_maker.approach: City-owned event venue. Hosts concerts, events, conventions. Same Henderson procurement. During events, high foot traffic. Backstage/employee areas + public areas.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Major event venue with high attendance during events. Backstage/employee areas need amenities. Convention attendees are captive audience.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Revenue is event-dependent but Henderson hosts many community events year-round.

decision_maker.title: Facility Manager / Parks & Rec
decision_maker.approach: Another Henderson Parks & Rec facility. Bundle with Multigenerational Center for city-wide recreation deal.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Community recreation center with sports programs, after-school activities, events. Parents and kids = impulse purchases. Consistent daily traffic.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Henderson has 72 parks and multiple recreation centers. Each is a potential placement.

decision_maker.title: Facility Manager / Parks & Rec
decision_maker.approach: Third Henderson rec center. Bundle with city-wide deal.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Community recreation center. Same Tier 1 criteria as other rec centers. Sports tournaments, camps, classes.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Part of Henderson recreation center portfolio opportunity.

decision_maker.title: CEO / VP of Facilities
decision_maker.approach: YMCA is a nonprofit with multiple LV-area facilities. Contact central office for multi-location deal. YMCAs are traditionally receptive to vending/amenity partnerships. Revenue share is especially attractive to nonprofits.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Multiple YMCA locations across LV valley. Recreation centers are Tier 1 per Skool. Families, kids programs, pools, gyms. Revenue share is attractive to nonprofit organizations - they get passive income.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: YMCA locations are perfect Tier 1 - families, kids, sports, long visits. Nonprofit = receptive to revenue share. Multiple locations = portfolio deal.

decision_maker.title: Owner / General Manager
decision_maker.approach: Climbing gyms are a growing niche. Members spend 2-4 hours per visit. Pop-in, ask for owner. Small business = fast decisions.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Climbers spend 2-4 hours per session. Post-climb hunger is real. Young, active demographic = buys protein snacks, energy drinks. Growing sport with dedicated following.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Climbing gyms are a growing trend. Members are passionate and spend long sessions. Henderson location.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.company: Henderson International School / Private Schools Cluster

decision_maker.title: Head of School / Facilities Director
decision_maker.approach: Private schools have more flexibility than CCSD public schools. Decision maker is usually the Head of School. Pitch healthy smart market for students, staff, and visiting parents.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Schools are Tier 1 per Skool insights - 'never seen an unprofitable school'. Students are impulsive buyers. Private schools can make decisions without district bureaucracy.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Henderson has multiple private/charter schools. Each is independent = faster decision process than CCSD.

decision_maker.title: General Manager / Membership Director
decision_maker.approach: Premium athletic club in Green Valley. Members pay premium memberships. Pop-in, pitch upscale smart market matching their premium brand.

segment_5_fitness_recreation.why_good_fit: Premium athletic club. Members pay $100+/month. Affluent Henderson demographic. Tennis, pools, gym, classes. Members spend hours at the club. Premium products = premium margins.
segment_5_fitness_recreation.notes: Henderson's premier private athletic club. Premium member base = higher average transaction.
